inn1.comm: there wasn't much bounce there, Hafeez stayed on the backfoot and managed to angle it wide of point
that's a gift from Malinga, rare one that too, generous half volley outside off and Farhat was happy to thump that past cover
the inswinging yorker already! Well kept out by Farhat, square leg dived and got a hand to it, time to sneak a single
a gift on the pads down the leg side, Hafeez shuffled just a touch and clipped it to the fine leg boundary, poor ball, deserved what it got
this time he gets his direction right, just outside off, still not much bounce, left alone to the keeper
played down the pitch and Malinga failed to get a hand to it, no damage as mid-off runs across to pick it up
angling in on the pads, in the slot for Farhat to clip it behind square leg
full and swinging in but more around middle and off, squeezed out by Farhat, the bowler gets a hand to it
holds the length back and gives him width, reaches out and cuts to third man who's quite square
hones in on the off stump, he's trying to keep it full to encourage some swing with this new ball, pushed to mid-off
goes straight through to the keeper this time, a hint of away movement though
gets forward and opens the face of the bat, glides it past a diving point
Malinga gives it a bit more effort, bangs it hard on the pitch but yet again not much bounce before it goes through to the keeper
gets a half stride forward and pushes it towards point
similar ball, similar shot, Malinga's settling into the line he prefers and should maintain
a bit slower through the air, gave Hafeez enough time to get forward and angle it wide of point
Farhat pulls but he's not in good control of it, could have so easily top edged it, anyway he gets enough distance to clear square leg
oh well! Gets forward a bit too early and the ball kicks up and nearly hits him on the thumb, nevertheless no damage done
Good effort by Tharanga at the deep midwicket boundary! Easily clipped away off the front foot by Farhat, Tharanga gives the chase from mid-on and just pulls it back
another good effort, this time at mid-off, Hafeez  punches it quite well
gets forward and leaves it to the keeper
Dropped Uppish drive off the front foot and Thissara is not quick enough in his follow through to cup the ball above his face, not the easiest catch
stays back and defends back to the bowler
lets it go to the keeper
fullish delivery outside off and he pushes it gently to the off side
loss of concentration from Farhat! Gets forward to a pitched up delivery and the drive meets thin air, close to the edge there
Fernando drifted on the pads at a gentle pace, Farhat just works it on its way to fine leg, despairing dive by the fielder
pushes it to the off side
hits a god length outside off and the batsman is happy to let that go to the keeper
stays back and pushes it to the packed off side field, think Hafeez wanted a run, he managed to make it back
lands it just outside off and gets it to go through straight to the keeper
this time he gets forward and defends it towards short cover, Perera has stuck to a fuller length
slower in pace and swinging in, he pushes it thorough the line to mid-on
another fuller one, uppishly driven and the bowler tried to get a hand to it, mid-off slides and cuts it off
gets forward and punches it to the alert off side field
stays back this time and gently pushes it to the off side
in the slot to drive and he does exactly that, only the he finds cover
full and slower, wide outside off, another boundary ball which finds the fielder, point this time
much better, in the line of the stumps and cramps him for room, can't do much better than to defend that
another slower one and he tries to drive straight but gets an inside edge towards midwicket, gets a couple anyway
short and wide down the leg side, Farhat wasn't quick enough to pull that past the keeper

ouch! Bang on the helmet! Farhat just didn't see that, he was rooted to the crease, he didn't look like attempting a shot, wasn't quick enough to swerve away, it's got him on the right side of his forehead, he didn't flinch initially, then took his helmet off, the physio comes out. No need to panic though, he's conscious, on his feet and just trying to get his bearings back
and yet another wide down the leg side, poor delivery, full and swinging away, well kept by Sanga
tucked towards square leg, he thinks of a single
plays a short-arm pull past square leg, on one leg, good shot to get the pressure off
hits a good length outside off, left alone
another stylish pull over square leg, but there's protection in the deep
oh that just HAD to be hit, full and swinging away, sat up nicely for Farhat to get forward and smack it past the covers, forget about chasing it
the square drive past point, Perera is being very generous with his width, gets forward and does the honours, good comeback after that blow to the head
better line and length, doesn't give him the room to swish, pushed towards mid-off
tucks him up for room, all he can do is defend to the off side
and once again Fernando gets the line and length right, forces the batsman back and tap it back down the pitch
slower ball on the pads and it hits him on the leg as he tries to flick, wide of leg stump though
full again but outside off, Hafeez aims to play straight but ends up getting an inside edge to the on side
strays on the pads, quick one though, 146 kph, the batsman wasn't quick enough to get enough bat on that
clipped to the on side and there's confusion in the calling, Hafeez couldn't make up his mind if he wanted the run or not, sent Farhat back
lands it on the area just outside off, hint of away movement before going through to the keeper
shorter this time, opportunity to cut it away  but he finds extra cover instead
nearly gloved that! Sanga was up with the appeal immediately, Hafeez went forward to a ball which fizzed past his glove, should have stayed back
pushes it to the off side
stays behind the line and punches it to the off side
pushes it softly towards mid-off
stays back and punches it to the on side for a single
stays back, waits for the turn and cuts towards point
commits to thye sweep early and eases it to deep square leg
pushes the ball down the line to long-on
tried to cut that one and nearly edged it! The extra bounce took him by surprise
stays back and punches it with the turn to mid-on
lands it wide outside off and he helps himself to a cut to deep point
fuller in length and driven down to deep cover
this one came on straight and squared him up a bit, managed to defend it
the slog sweep this time, Malinga's there at deep square leg to pick it up

there's an lbw appeal and Sri Lanka have referred it, Hafeez tried to sweep and he appeared to miss it completely, he was well forward of course, Erasmus said not out, the graphics show the ball shaving off stump but still a bit touch and go, nevertheless Hafeez got the benefit of the doubt
punches it back to the bowler
stays back, waits for the turn and places it to the off side
gets forward and pushes it through the line to long-on
defends it back to the bowler
pushes it towards long-off for a single
drives on the front foot past the diving bowler, long-on picks it up
looked like the googly, the batsman made room and tapped it towards mid-off
another googly, this time he plays with the turn towards mid-on
taps it with soft hands and sets off for a quick single, good running and calling
comes forward early and nearly yorks himself, gently pushes it to the bowler
that's a thump! Stays at the crease expecting another incoming delivery, picks the length early and clubs it over midwicket, good bat speed there
gives a hint of room and pushes it towards mid-off
rocks back and punches it hard towards deep cover
stays back and gently taps it towards point
clips it to the on side gently
commits to the front foot and eases it towards mid-on
gets forward to the pitch of the ball and eases a single to long-off
ok that was a real real loosener! Friendly full-pitched ball wide outside off and hardly any pace on that as well, Farhat had enough time to get on his knee and scoop it over backward point
pushed to the off side
he tried the slower ball but it went too wide outside off for Farhat to chase it
much better line, closer to the off stump and he drives straight to backward point
cuts it wide of the fielders near the point ring
he bangs it in short and aims for the ribs, Hafeez isn't in full control of the pull but manages to keep it down, fine leg picks it up
fires it on a yorker length outside off, just manages to squeeze it out, the ball bobs to Sangakkara
bowled the off cutter this time, Hafeez plays it safe and lets it go to the keeper
another slower ball but this time honing in on the stumps, he manages to squeeze it down to mid-on
faster alright but not exactly a restrictive line! Short and wide outside off and Hafeez carved it past the gap between point and cover, Malinga knows he bowled a bad one
another slower ball and on the pads, flicked to the on side
another slower ball, clipped behind square leg, direct hit at the batsman's end but Farhat's safe
slips in the quicker one, climbs on the batsman but Farhat manages to fend it off
well Hafeez doesn't want to be left behind! Short enough to pull, he swiveled early and clubbed it behind square leg, that raced away
slower ball outside off, he commited to the front foot early and scooped it well wide of mid-off, didn't look much in control at first, he's getting into a good stride here
make that three in three! No slip, he had width outside off, enough time to open the face of the bat and deftly angle it wide of the keeper
he pushes it towards mid-off
he wasn't in control of that pull but a safe shot in the end, no blue shirts in the vicinity of midwicket

I will call that a chance! It was short and wide outside off, Hafeez upper cut it but in the direction of third man, Malinga unfortunately was a bit too much in front of the boundary and hence would have had to leap, if only he stood back near the rope
slower ball and pushed to the off side
an overstep, fends off a short ball to the off side and scampers a single, the fielder at backward flicks the ball towards the stumps on the dive
dropped at mid-on but it's a freehit! Made room and scooped a full ball straight to Dilshan
slower ball on the body and flicked down to fine leg
full and gets forward to drive it to deep cover
tucked to the on side and he scampers a single to reach his fifty
Farhat tries to whip that out of the ground, swishes at thin air, that wasn't far from the edge or the off stump
taps it to the off side
angles in on his body and he clips it towards square leg
worked to the on side, Sri Lanka still search for that breakthrough, 100 up for Pakistan
driven firmly off the front foot but straight to mid-off
makes room and pushes it towards cover
slow off the air and pitch, gives Hafeez time to plan his shot, makes room and places it towards cover again
nearly offered a return catch there, driven on the up wide of Dilshan
down the track but straight to midwicket
drops it a fraction too short, he stays back and pulls, Dilhara mops up at long leg
gets forward and drives, beats the diving cover fielder
gets forward and drives past the bowler
once again makes room and cuts to the deep on the off side
gets forward and chips it uppishly towards midwicket, cry of 'catch it' but it dropped well short
gets forward and drives straight to long-off
more flight, midwicket dives to get a hand to it, that forces Hafeez to stay back at his crease
the bowler dives to his right this time to cut it off
driven straight to cover
has a bit of room this time to ease it past point
makes room and he angles it straight to point, decides against the single
yet again makes room and dabs it straight to point
decides to go the other way and it works! Gets on his knee and sweeps it off the meat of the bat and the ball scorches past square leg
Dropped, well this is not helping SL, driven on the up and firmly, Prasanna fumbles at cover, he had to throw himself to his left, reflexes werent good enough
brings up the reverse paddle towards short third man
eases a single to long-on and he joins the fifties club for the evening, well played
exposes his stumps again, dabs it towards point and eases to a single
gets forward and gently pushes it to cover
punches it towards mid-on
pushes it down the track to the bowler
after two dot balls he manages to get off the strike with a single to long-on
stays back and punches it to long-on
he committed himself to the reverse paddle early and that disturbed the bowler's rhythm, ended up being a wide down the leg side
worked to square leg for a single
dabs it towards point, the throw is to the batsman's end, Sanga whips off the bails, it goes upstairs  but he's safe
goes for the sweep but the ball ends up rolling to midwicket
goes back and punches it back to the bowler
full on the pads and pushed to long-on
flatter through the air, no turn, punches it down to deep cover
resorts to bowling it flat again, and once more eased off the pads to the on side
everyone at long-on take cover! The crowd I mean, Farhat comes down the pitch and carts it several rows behind
now tucks it behind square for a single
makes room and tucks it to long-on
commits to the sweep early and places it behind square
makes room and cuts towards deep point
Hafeez goes over the ropes! Flighted on off and middle, he gets on his knee and whams that over deep midwicket
gets forward and drives to cover
an uppish drive this time wide of cover
unfurls the reverse sweep but can't beat point
this time places it wide of short third man
low full toss and eased away to long-on
slower ball on the pads and gently clipped towards deep square leg
now he hits the deck harder and gets the ball to skid past the outside edge, Farhat tried to glide it to third man, not the smartest choice of shot I'm afraid
fuller and honing in on the stumps, squeezed out to point
full and wide and not far from the toe edge of the bat, Sanga acknowledges a good delivery
short on the body and he pulls it along the ground to fine leg
Fernando wrecks a decent over by giving him a gift on the pads, low full toss drifting wide of leg stump, all he had to do was get some bat on it, thank you very much
sweeps a full toss to fine leg
some relief for SL at last! Prasanna bowls it flat and towards leg stump, Hafeez tried to pull it but was on the shot too early, the ball ended up rebounding off the pads onto the leg stump
Razzaq defends is first ball to cover
gets off the mark with a push to cover, risky run, the throw at is ends was just wide and Razzaq did quite a tumble, he's ok
spooned drive, the ball appears to fall just short of Prasanna's left, could have taken it if he timed his dive better
gets beside the line and pushes it to the off side

a Suresh Raina like hoick over the on side, picks up a length ball from the off stump and swings across the line without much foot movement, finds the open spaces though, one bounce and four towards wide long-on
squeezes out a full ball towards point, misfield there
this time he manages some inswing, Razzaq does well to cover the line of the ball
cramps him for room as he defends, Fernando keeping him under check here
three out of three, this time he varies it by dropping it shorter, Razzaq is squared up for pace and bounce and is beaten
fullish in length and gently pushed towards long-on to ease the pressure after those dot balls
fullish and pushed back to the bowler
pushed back to the bowler again
teased him with extra flight, fails to make contact with the drive
he left it alone probably expecting a wide, not to be
gets forward and angles it wide of point
flatter through the air and he gets on his knee and sweeps

The captain himself has shown the way, Farhat tried to repeat that six., stepped down the track to launch him over long-on, it was a much flatter shot but the elevation wasn't enough to clear Jayawardene
gets forward and taps it to the on side
clipped to the on side
opens the face of the bat and dabs it to backward point
flicks it but finds short fine leg
Scampers through for a quick single to square leg
Dropped Whacks a full toss back to the bowler, Prasanna gets his right hand to it but the ball deflects away, tough one
turns it to backward square leg
Another one bites the dust! Very similar in style to Farhat's fall, he steps down the track to clear long-on, can't clear the fielder, hit flat to Perera
gets on his knee and gets off the mark with a sweep to fine leg
gets well forward and defends
sweeps and the ball is in the air for a while, drops well short of long leg though
Umar brings up the reverse sweep early in his knock, can't beat short third man
pushes a low full toss back to the bowler
stays back and clips it to square leg
he sticks to a flatter trajectory, the batsman lunges forward and drives to the off side
opens the face of the bat and dabs it wide of cover for a quick single
slower ball and he works it through the line down to long-on
fullish outside off and he gets forward and squirts it out to point
breaks the shackles a bit, drops it a fraction short and Umar gets in position early to play that horizontal bat shot past the arc between mid-on and midwicket, neat pull

and Malinga hits back in the way he knows best - at the stumps, Umar moved across his stumps to play an adventurous flick to fine leg, beaten for pace, the ball hammered the leg stump, you have to say that Umar squandered the opportunity to build on the powerplay
greets him with a full inswinger on the pads, he squeezes it out to square leg
gets beside the line and pats it to the off side
cramps him for a bit of room again, another dot ball to the off side
make that three, mid-off does the fielding, Misbah is trying to get his eye in
this is proving to be a really good over in the Powerplay, Misbah dabbed at it softly, Younis was desperate to get to the other end, would have been a very risky run
he eases the pressure a bit by taking a single towards deep point
ugly cricket there, the ball was short and wide and waiting to be hit...somewhere...all Younis could do was flash hard and get an underedge
slower ball and all he can do is gently tap at it, good deception from the bowler
he cranks up the pace and fires it full, another dot ball as he tamely pushes it back to the bowler
low full toss swinging in on the pads, Tharanga mops up at deep square leg
taps it softly and yells at his partner to stay back at his crease
he covers the stumps early before the bowler delivers to counter the inswing, clips it off his pads to the on side

very nearly a repeat of Umar's dismissal, he gets a bit adventurous with the shuffle across the stumps to flick it to fine leg, he gets bat on it alright but to the fielder, managed to get his bat down in time or else he was a goner
a bit short, he gets beside the line and taps it wide of point
a bit more room this time to work with, he opens the face and dabs it down to third man
just clears mid-on! Fuller in length and Younis scoops it just over the reach of the fielder, would have been a terrific catch
pushes it back to the bowler, Perera fumbles as he tries to gather and fling it back at the stumps
dabbed to third man
gets beside the line and chops it to the off side for a single
slower ball on the pads, he makes a bit of room and somehow clips it to the on side
moves across his stumps and flicks a full and quick one across the line to deep square leg

This was comical! Misbah stayed at the crease to gently dab it to the on side, there was a quick single there for the taking and Younis charged off from the wordgo, Misbah however wasn't interested and stayed put, Malinga ran to the batsman's end, gathered the ball and Misbah and him had a running race to the other side, Malinga whipped off the bails. Well there was no competition in that race in the first place, Misbah threw in the towel long before
gently dabs it towards point
this time he works it off his pads to the on side
Malinga welcomes him with a bouncer! safely negotiate
goes across his stumps and clips it wide of square leg
clipped towards midwicket and Prasanna sprints manfully to do the fielding himself and restrict it to a single
gets on his knee early and sweeps
clipped to the on side again for a single
stays back and chips it uppishly down to long-on, lots of spaces there
quicker and flatter, the ball clipped the pads and rolled on the pitch
opens the face and dabs it to the on side past point
gives him a bit more width and he cuts hard to the sweeper on the off side
punches it just wide of mid-on and has to scamper that single because the fielder Prasanna was quick to gather and have a shy at the stumps
pushes it to the off side
full and swinging in outside off, he gets his bat down and squeezes it to the off side
dabs it towards extra cover and sets off for a quick single and the non-striker has to hurry to make his ground
sweeps hard but mistimes it, can only fetch a single to short fine leg
flatter and quicker, makes a lot of room and thumps it to deep extra cover
slower delivery, stays back and punches it down the pitch
gives room and clips it wide of mid-on
makes room again and slashes it to the deep on the off side, can't find that big gap there
action replay, Prasanna's bowling it slower, making the batsman use power to get the ball scorching through, not happening at the moment though
shuffles and clips it down to square leg for a single
works it to the on side, they hesitate a bit for the second run but the throw at the bowler's end was too high and wide
quicker one, shorter and an opportunity for the batsman to wham that over the on side, he misses it
fuller, and he gets forward and places it to the deep on the off side
full again and he digs it out towards cover
loses his direction with the slower ball as he drifts down the leg side, Afridi wasn't expecting it either
the kind of shot the crowd was waiting for, full and swinging away, he made room, got under the bounce and bashed it along the turf wide of cover, boundary to deep cover
The swing beat everybody, down the leg side, on a yorker length, the batsman couldn't get any bat on it and Sanga couldn't slide quick enough to stop the ball
tapped to the off side for a quick single
brave enough to bowl the slower ball a touch shorter to Afridi outside off, Afridi opens the face and takes a single to third man
slower ball again but Younis' dab to the off side finds the fielder
another dot ball, slower ball and he pushes it to the off side again
clips it to the on side for a single
Malinga maintains the stranglehold as he concedes just a singe again, clipped to the on side near square leg
That pretty much went into orbit! Fine catch in the end by Angelo just a few yards in front of the sightscreen, Afridi stayed at the crease and gave it everything, massive skier
Chipped it over the bowler's head and Angelo runs across to pick it up from long-on
fullish outside off an pushed to the off side
gets a thick outside edge, third man mops up
opens the face of the bat and takes a single wide of point
reaches out to a wide delivery and ends up getting an inside edge to the on side
another inswinging yorker, how does a batsman fresh at the crease put that away? The ball dribbles to the on side
squeezes out another yorker, the ball dribbles to the off side and Younis just about beats the throw
wild swish outside off and he only manages an inside edge to the on side
another yorker, Sarfraz can only flat-bat it past the bowler for a single
slower ball honing in on the leg stump, he can only nudge it to the on side
trademark Malinga, Inswinging yorker, Sarfraz makes room but only manages a thick inside edge onto his stumps, what a comeback by Sri Lanka
pushed towards point
digs it in short and within Younis' comfort zone, sat up nicely for him to pull it down to long leg, no fielders there so good placement
slower ball outside off and he opens the face and angles it to third man for a single
Tanvir didn't see that at all I think, short of a length and the ball hit the handle and lobbed up, fortunately short of the fielders
bangs it in short this time and the ball fizzes past Tanvir who tries to pull, quick bouncer
repeats the shot but this time he manages to get enough wood to send the ball flying past the vacant slips position and down to third man
full and swinging away, he manages to dig it out for a single to the off side
yorker outside off and he jams it down to mid-off, singles again, they need more of those boundaries - streaky or not
jams out another yorker but straight to point
exactly what we meant by streaky, he hoicks that from outside off and he gets a thick inside edge which sneaks past the stumps and beats short fine leg
shortish in length outside off, he cuts to deep point
the fine leg may have gone back for Tanvir but he too had no chance, swinging yorker on the toes, a little but of wood was enough to send that on its way to fine leg
tried to muscle that down the ground but he mistimed it towards mid-on
slower ball and short as well, Tanvir swung too early and the ball clipped his body and rolled to the off side

that's a direct hit at the bowler's end and that looked very close even at normal speed, the ball was pushed to mid-on and Prasanna released the ball immediately after gathering it, Younis was well short and dropped his bat after reaching the crease, the third umpire confirms it
yorker on middle and squeezed out to the off side
Gul fails to read a slower bouncer, the variations in pace have confounded quite a few Pakistan batsmen today
two dot balls to signal the end of the innings, another bouncer and Gul swings at thin air

inn2.comm: begins with a friendly wide down the leg side, too far for Tharanga to reach out
this time he directs it wide outside off, easy helping for Tharanga to slap it past backward point and cover

what a response! The off stump is flattened! I'm not sure Tharanga actually saw that because it appeared to skid off the pitch, he was rooted to the crease, the ball landed on a good length, held its line and hit the top of the off stump, landed a yard or two back. This is Gul's first wicket in the one-day series
marginal call for a wide down the leg side considering that it wasn't too far from the glove
strays on the body again and he easily clips it away to fine leg
stays behind the line, taps it in front of mid-on who's up and takes a quick single, just manages to beat the throw to the bowler's end
time for more drama here as Dilshan jet-sets out of his crease and then scampers back to beat the throw which was from midwicket
clipped behind square leg and they take the first one quickly, take a second as well
edged but it drops short! Thick outside edge on the drive and second slip dives to his right but the ball falls short and races away
strays on the body and easily clipped away to fine leg
hits a good length and at a good pace, Sanga gets across and taps it to the on side
the swing takes it towards the pads and it's child's play for Sanga who gently flicks it wide of the keeper to fine leg
shuffles across to cover the inward movement, clips it wide of midwicket for a couple
takes it away from the left-hander a bit, leaves it alone
short of a length outside off, pushed into the covers.
strays on the pads this time, Dilshan tucks it away behind square for one.
pacy and flashy! Gul pushes it across at speed, the ball kicks up from the turf too. Sanga has a huge flay at it, but can't connect.
back of a length, Sanga tucks it off the pads towards square leg.
good length, nipping in towards Dilshan who is pressing forward as he defends to the off side.

legcutter to end the over! Gul is a specialist at this, and he made Dilshan look like a bunny the other day. Not very different now as it darts away past one of the more ambitious booming cover drives you will see.
stays behind the line this time and defends to the off side.
Tanvir chugs in at 133 kph, Sanga gets forward and plays a full ball back to the bowler.
this one curves it with Tanvir's natural angle, and Sanga defends off the front foot to mid-on.
back of a length and darting in again, defended off the pads to the leg side.
shorter still, Sanga gets inside the line and works it to the leg side.
whistles away off the seam, across Dilshan who is pushing away without moving the feet forward enough. Nervy stuff this for Dilly.
Rippa! Square Dilshan up as it snakes away off the seam, and the outside edge drops in front of the cordon.
just a bit too much width, the bounce was a touch steep as well but Sanga did well to rock back and slap it just wide of point, classy
and this time Gul beats him, drops it a fraction fuller and the batsman is uncertain what to do
moves across his stumps and clips it away behind square, the scoreboard is moving at a steady rate
tucks him up for room with a straight one, gets behind the line and defends
similar delivery, shows the full face of the bat and defends
opens the face and dabs it in front of the slips and tells his partner to stay back
teases him with a fuller delivery and Dilshan drives and misses, close to the edge there
comes round the wicket, he clips it in front of short midwicket and bravely sets off for a run, the under-arm flick is too high, had he hit Sangakkara would have gone, there were overthrows as well
angles it on the pads and he gently clips it wide of midwicket for a single
the ball suddenly straightened after pitching and completely squared him up, Sangakkara was playing for the angle which was moving away from him, he was hit on the thigh instead
full and wide and he chases it, results in a thick outside edge which beats the slips and Gul fails to time his dive properly at third man, should have stopped that
shuffles across his stumps and drops it in front of midwicket
slices it just wide of backward point, thinks of a single
clips it hard towards midwicket, Chandimal is padded up to come in next
in the slot for Dilshan to scoop it over extra cover, full and sits up well, got enough elevation to clear the infield
chases a wide delivery outside off and manages to slice it to third man
places it in the gap between backward point and cover, one of them does a relay throw
he continues round the wicket but strays down the leg side

not the most elegant of square cuts but it's good enough to fetch a boundary, Dilshan chases a wide one, thumps it hard but places it in the gap at point, Umar does extremely well to chase it but the outfield was too quick, he pushes the ball back but it rolls to the fence
lands it outside off and he leaves it alone
stays behind the line and defends
thumps it again off the toe edge of the bat, places it just wide of point
full on the pads and he clips it down to midwicket
generous with his width, Sangakkara cuts him to third man
starts off well with a length ball on the stumps, safely defended
once again maintains that line and length, the batsman defends it again
angles on the pads and he works it down to fine leg
places it straight to Afridi at short cover
crashed past the covers, pitched up and in the slot to drive off the front foot, Dilshan exploited quite a big gap there
less effort, same result - this time he eases it past backward point and cover off the backfoot, Razzaq needs to be careful not to give him too much width here
tapped back to the bowler
full and swinging away, Sangakkara pushes it just wide of mid-off and sets off for a quick single, Umar Akmal has a shy at the bowler's end
gets behind and defends it to point
leaves it alone to the keeper, good bounce and carry
gets away with it by giving him width, punched hard straight to cover
clips it hard and yet again finds the fielder, this time at midwicket
gets forward and pushes it to the off side
drops it down towards point and tells his partner to stay back
gets well forward and smothers the turn
gets forward and turns it in front of square leg and sets off
first signs of turn here, he blocks it to the on side
gets forward and eases it down to long-on for a single
starts off with a loosener down the leg side as Dilshan pulls straight to short fine leg
stays back and thumps it to the sweeper on the off side
comes well forward and places it to the sweeper on the off side
that sweeper is being kept busy alright, front foot drive by Dilshan this time
he bowls it slower through the air beats the edge on the forward prod
gets forward and blocks it out
gets a bit of turn again, he just about manages to defend it
comes well forward and pushes it to the off side
clips it with the turn past square leg
that inside edge must have caught the batsman in a nervy moment, the ball rolls to fine leg
comes forward and defends to the off side
drives firmly back to the bowler
clipped away easily wide of midwicket for a single
comes well forward and blocks it out
Afridi has a slip, pushed to the off side and another dot ball, Pakistan will hope for more of those
driven on the front foot wide of Afridi's grasp, single to long-off
driven again off the front foot down to long-off
we haven't seen the shooter yet from Afridi, he's keeping it full, this time driven to sweeper on the off side
drops it in front of cover and sets off for a quick single
chips down the track and clips it down to midwicket
gets to the pitch and drives through the line down to long-off
defended again, keeps him quiet there
angles it on middle, waits for the turn and clips it to midwicket
fires it quicker and flatter, clips it again to the on side
dabs it towards point and tells his partner to stay back
once again he quietly pushes it to the covers
rocks back and times the punchy quite crisply past extra cover
this time he comes forward and works it wide of midwicket
contines round the wicket to the right-hander, pushes it towards cover
comes forward and pushes it through the line to long-on
chops it straight to point
stays back and pushes it through the line to long-off
cuts it straight towards point
makes room and cuts hard but the fielder at point does well to intercept it
rocks back and punches it down the ground to long-on
clips it towards mid-on and Dilshan is off the blocks quickly, good running overall
another really sharp single, Dilshan's on wheels here, gets there comfortably before point's underarm flick reaches the keeper
close call as he defends and the ball lobs up, spins backwards and nearly lobs on to the stumps, Sarfraz knew how close that was
gets forward and defends, the ball is in the air for a bit
fires it down the leg side but it beats the bat and Sarfraz, that didnt look too far from the stumps

Now this is interesting! Places it to cover, sanga wanted the single, Dilshan wasn't interested, Afridi fired a throw to the keeper who whipped off the bails, Dilshan was touch and go in reaching the crease, the keeper saw that Sanga had almost come all the away to the batsman's end, Sarfraz threw the ball to the bowler's end but Sanga came in the way involuntarily, Hafeez had a shy at the stumps at the bowler's end which went for four overthrows, the appeal for a run-pout at Dilshan's end was referred to the third umpire who gave Dilshan the benefit of doubt
he responds by coming down the pitch and whamming him over extra cover for four
driven to long-off
driven to long-off
clipped to deep square leg
gets forward and defends quietly
opens the face and angles it to third man
strays down the leg side and wide called
chips down the track and clips him over midwicket, one bounce to the fielder at the deep
takes a single to long-off and that's a half-century for Dilshan, captain leading the way here
stays back and punches him on the up towards short midwicket, the ball dropped just in front of fielder, close call though
he gets on his knee and slog sweeps it and it was in the air for a while, the fielder runs across and picks it up
pulled and once again Sanga gets away as the ball drops short of short midwicket
takes a single to long-off
drops it in front of the covers and charges off for another quick single
raised hopes for a breakthrough there as Sangakara took the aerial route over mid-on, Gul decided to take it on the first bounce, could he have gone for it? I'm not sure
fired in full and flat outside off and ploughed down to long-off
keeps it full and straight, defended solidly
he keeps it tight and full, doesn't give Dilshan room to break away
slower through the air this time and he makes room and chops it wide of Hafeez at cover who does well to slide and save a few runs
defended back to the bowler
squeezes it easily down to long-off, another easy single
chopped down to point, hits a good length straight up
tucks him up for room, he defends back to the bowler
well not quite, angles it across the left-hander, he slices it straight to backward point

it's that man again, Afridi! Sangakkara clipped it towards mid-on to keep the score moving but Dilshan wasn't interested as it was anyway going to be a sharp single, too late as Sangakkara was already at the other end of town, Afridi's direct hit at the batsman's end send the off stump for a spin, Sanga was furious as he walked back, i don't need to describe Afridi's celebration...
clips it down to midwicket for a single
opens the face of the bat and angles it wide of third man, scamper through for a second run and there's a slight collision between Dilshan and Sarfraz
defends inside out and Afridi naturally is all pumped up
gets forward and drives him down to long-on
stays back and defends to the off side
gets forward and drives him down to long-off
drives it back to the bowler and Afridi gets the crowd behind him as he contemplates throwing it back
driven hard back to the bowler again
gets forward and takes a couple down to sweeper cover
stays on the backfoot this time and slices him toward sweeper cover
tries to tease him into the pull by bowling a bouncer but he slid it down the leg side
punched hard but straight to the man at cover, you can see a spring in their step after that run-out
comes forward and dabs it down to point, there are fielders on the prowl around that off side
circumspect running again! Are we seeing the panic spreading here? He shuffles and clips it towards mid-on and attempts a cheeky run,  he's sent back but the throw to Sarfraz is too wide
turns it past midwicket for a single
hurries him on the front foot, he defends
eases the nerves with a slog over midwicket, on his knee, finds the big gap and hits it cleanly
clips it towards deep square leg
gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler
tries to work it to the on side but fails
slides it down the leg side
pushes it back to the bowler
reads the doosra just in time, manages to defend it away
stays back and defends to the on side
another doosra, he tucks it to the on side
stays on the backfoot and cuts wide of point
and Dilshan beats the off side gap! Makes a bit of room, waits for it to turn away, cuts hard past the diving point fielder, short third man gives up the chase

a freak dismissal and it's Afridi again! Afridi slides it down the leg side, it was so wide that Dilshan may well have left it, he went for the sweep anyway but the ball ended up hitting his arm and then spun towards the stumps, Dilshan tried to bat it away but it was too late
comes well forward and defends to long-off
defends back to the bowler
clips it to the on side for a single
classic stuff from Chandimal, took advantage of the fact that the ball was pitched too short and wide, rocked back and thumped it past deep extra cover
defends back to the bowler and he's sent back
gets right across his stumps and paddles it past the keeper, Gul mops up at fine leg
lunges forward and pushes it to the off side
fires it flat and quick, he pushes it through the line to long-on
opens the face and tries to glide it past short third man
just checks his drive back to the bowler
turns it wide of square leg and they put pressure on the fielders by taking two
punches it down the ground to long-on
gives it a lot of air and lands it on the yorker length, he digs it out to short third man
Mahela reaches out to drive and he gets a thick outside edge which beats the keeper and runs away
the googly this time and he cuts straight to cover
dawdled onto the pads, worked square for a single.
ooh, Mahela gets a leading edge as he looks to work a straight ball with the angle, but it holds up a bit to take the edge and go to the off side.
middles the check-drive now, pushes a single to long-on.
Chandimal shuffles in and plays alarmingly late, but gets the flick away for a single to square leg.
legcutter at 117 kph, Mahela leans out and drives watchfully to mid-off.
pushes this onto the pads, Mahela gets the front foot inside the line and nudges behind square. Drinks for the last time today.
he reaches forward and clips it wide of square leg
slower through the air and defended to the on side
and Mahela deftly  dabs this past the keeper and down to third man, he knows where the fielders are, he;s now on 9999 runs
congrats Mahela on reaching 10000 ODI runs! He's the 9th batsman to do so, (with a single to midwicket), no major celebrations or emotion, he knows what his real job is today
gets forward and defends to the off side
defended to the off side again
chipped in the air down towards short mid-on, funny old shot but a safe one
directs it on the body and he clips him down to fine leg
clipped straight to midwicket, this is shaping up to be a good partnership for Sri Lanka
once again opens the face and plays that cheeky dab to third man, the fielder runs across to mop up
this one skids through and nearly takes the edge
this time he cuts him down towards third man
gives it a lot of air, he lunges forward and clips him to midwicket
chops it towards short third man
gets forward and defends quietly, Mahala is keeping a cool head
opens the face of the bat and steers it to short third man
steers it wide of shirt third man again, he's been eyeing that area to score
gets forward and clips him down to mid-on
short of a length ball and he defends off the back foot
this time he gets it to skid it past the batsman, he attempts another steer down to third man
maintains a neat stump to stump line, Mahela can only defend it back
stays beside the line and steers it towards point
skids past the edge again, tries to cut, turning out to be a quiet over for Sri Lanka
pushes it towards mid-off, good over by Razzaq, this will increase the pressure
wide down the leg side and Mahela tried to glance it but for some reason he got very excited

Ajmal bowls from round the wicket, beats the batsman with extra bounce, Mahela is well forward and tries to drag his foot back, Sarfraz whips off the bails in a flash and he's super confident, the third umpire takes a look, very very tough call but the third umpire reckons his foot was in the air. It was a tight one but I think the umpire may have got it right. When the bail was off the rim, Mahela's foot was in the danger zone, excellent work by Sarfraz
comes forward and glances it towards short fine leg
pushed towards mid-on and once again there's confusion in the calling
hits the pads as he gets down to defend the ball lobs to slip
glances it down to short fine leg
comes round the wicket, he flicks it with the angle down to square leg
quick delivery honing in on middle, he defends inside out
keeps it straight on the stumps and keeps the batsman quiet, Sri Lanka can't seem to break free at the moment
comes forward and tries to create an opportunity to bisect the gaps but only finds point, runs at a premium here for SL
they wouldn't mind more of those, wide down the leg side, bit of work for Sarfraz to cut that off
no room again this time, keeps the batsman on the backfoot, defended down the pitch
changes his pace by bowling the slower ball, he can only steer it straight to the fielder, he has now played 10 dot balls in the powerplay
the dot ball count is increasing, dabbed back to the bowler
this round the wicket line is proving difficult for Sl to look for scoring opportunities, he tries to flick it but checks his shot
yet another dot ball, pushes it to the off side, he's not trying to sweep him
charges down the track and tries to hit him straight, good placement but not enough in it to carry it for a boundary
opens the face and dabs him down to short third man
tucks it towards short fine leg and sets off, the fielder fumbles
that should give him a lot of confidence, chips down the pitch and elegantly flicks him over midwicket to the wide open spaces, great use of the wrists
good comeback by Tanvir who bowls it quicker and gets the ball to skid through to the off stump, all he can do is defend
holds the length back from round the wicket, cramps him for room and Mathews can only defend it
this is the Angelo we know! Repeat of the earlier boundary in terms of style but this time he gets more elevation and clears long-on, good use of the feet and wrists again
another good comeback by Tanvir, holds the length back, cramps him for room and Angelo defends
no room again this time to work with, defends to the off side
continues round the wicket, he gets forward and pushes it wide of cover
stays back and clips it down to square leg for an easy single

the unpredictability continues! Chandimal comes down the pitch, tries to carve Ajmal inside out over the off side field, it's an odd looking shot because he was never in full control of it, Malik jogs back from point and takes the catch
comes forward and defends to the on side
pushes it to the off side and tells Malinga to stay back
and again he keeps him quiet, Angelo defends, he seems content blocking out the offspinner
beats the outsid edge and the stumps, too good for Malinga

big appeal, rather a vociferous appeal for lbw and the umpire gives him out, Malinga decides to review it, the googly cuts back in and hits him above the knee roll on the back pad as he prod forward to defend, no evidence of bat involved and the third umpire agrees with the original decision, that was hitting the stumps
gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler
comes forward and digs it out to the off side
pushes it towards cover, he yells and tells Mendis to scamper back which he just about does
tucks it towards midwicket and retains the strike
opens the face of the bat and steers it wide of point
a lucky boundary there, he opens the face of the bat and steers it past the keeper and short third man, no slip so he used it to his advantage
can't get this one past the bowler
turns it towards short square leg and goes through for a quick run
another quick single, he works it towards short square leg, there's a direct hit but he's home
inside out shot which lands in front of cover
not this time, he shows the full face of the bat and defends
third man again! Not exactly Angelo intended but that's irrelevant at this point, he was down the pitch to bash it over long-off, instead hit it off the toe of the bat and the ball went the other way
moves across his stumps and clips him to square leg, there's protection there
Mendis opens the face and runs it down to third man, no chance for a second run
the slower ball and he shuffles and clips him wide of short fine leg

clever adjustment by Mendis! The ball was short and angling across him, he arched back stuck his bat out and deftly dabbed it past the keeper and down to third man, it was close to an upper cut, Ajmal couldn't cut it off at third man
cramps him for room, he dabs it to to the off side
this time he manages to steer it wide of point
comes over the wicket to the left-hander, he shuffles across and glances it down to fine leg, they scamper through for a couple
cuts hard to sweeper on the off side and Mendis does really well to put pressure on the fielder by setting off for the second run, the throw wasn't good enough
full and wide outside off and he jams it out to third man
Mathews swings across the line, seemed a bit ungainly but he has found the gap at deep midwicket, this time they complete the second easily
That was slapped hard towards sweeper cover, Tanvir picks it up and another couple for Sri Lanka
teases him with flight and he holds back the pace of the ball, Mendis decides to defend
quicker one and that prompted Mendis to hoick across the line, gets an inside edge to the on side
not quite, he still opts to play safe and nudges it to the on side for a single

another twist here! Mendis' cameo comes to an end, he shuffles across a bit too much to clip it towards fine leg, the ball lands on middle stump (from round the wicket) and hits him in line with the stumps, the bat wasn't far away, the umpire was convinced
fires it flat and it skids through, he just manages to clip it away to retain the strike
he gets a leading edge that falls wide of point, Perera zips through for a couple
turned to the on side and he sets off and frantically heads back to the crease
comes forward and clips it towards midwicket
he slips it wide down the leg side and Mathews doesn't attempt a stroke
full on the stumps and driven down to long-on
he's got it to go straight through! Perera was foxed, the ball landed on off and straightened, played down the wrong line and he lost his off stump
gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler, gives the strike back to Mathews
he takes the aeriel route over the on side but finds the sweeper at deep square leg, just a single
strays towards the pads and he clips it off his pads down to fine leg
bowls the slower ball and he stays rooted to the crease and holds back on the hoick over the on side he was aiming for
Gul gets it to zip past the outside edge, beaten him for pace, too good for Prasanna
full and swinging in, Prasanna gives it everything but only succeeds in placing it to midwicket, another dot ball
a scoring opportunity there because it was a low full toss swinging in, he only managed to inside edge it to his pads
slower ball, swings hard and he fails to force it to the open spaces past midwicket
full and on the stumps, too good for Prasanna, he can only tamely push it down the pitch
and once again a clever change of pace, bowls it from wide of the stumps, Prasanna has a swish but he was too early on the shot
understatement to say that was a welcome boundary for SL, full and wide and Prasanna whammed it off the front foot past the diving cover fielder
low full toss and he pushes it down to long-off
another low full toss and he clips it towards long-on
full and swinging towards the pads, makes room and pushes it down to the deep on the on side
the slog sweep and Afridi takes the catch, Prasanna got forward and tried to get under the bounce and slog it over deep midwicket, the slower ball did him in, Afridi was there to take it
difficult to put those away, close to a yorker length, he forces it down to long-on
bowls the slower ball and Fernando jams it down on the pitch
Timber! Gul finishes the innings the same manner in which he started, full and straight on the pads, Fernando was rooted to the crease, the ball hits his pad and rebounds to the off stump
